keywords.cdata: Dams; Demand; Diversion structures; Electric power; Energy demand; Generators; Reservoirs; Transmission lines; Tunnels; Turbines; Water intake,,

project_abstract.cdata: The Andekaleka Hydroelectric Project for Madagascar will meet the growth in electricity demand until 1992 in the Antananarivo area, and provide for the strengthening of JIRAMA (Malagasy Electricity and Water Corporation). The major components of the project include: (a) a concrete diversion dam 10 m high and 125 m long, and an intake structure; (b) a tunnel 5.2 m in diameter and 4 km long; an underground power house for four 28-MW units, and tailrace and access tunnels; (c) two turbines and two 28-MW generators; (d) electrical and mechanical equipment; (e) a 138-kV, 150-km, transmission line to Antananarivo; (f) engineering services; (g) reservoir at Ankorahotra; and (h) technical assistance and training of JIRAMA staff.
